item.title: ClickHouse: How does a number have a set number of decimal places?
item.description: I’ve been working with a dataset in ClickHouse where I compute currency values and I really struggled to figure out how to get numbers whose decimal part is divisible by 10 to have a fixed number of decimal places. If you want to do that too, hopefully, this blog post will help. Let’s start by seeing what happens if we output the number 12.40 SELECT 12.40 AS number; Output ┌─number─┐ │ 12.
